reviews.review_msg: Talk a lot of useless stuffs during the class, and very careless about the grading, you can even recieve more than 5 grading update notification for one milestone.

This course is available for both graduate and undergraduate students but it is designed for graduate level. I would not recommend this course for undergraduate students. Prerequisite of "completion of nine units in Computing Science upper division courses" is not enough to do well in it. Take this course if you like a challenge and self learning.

The course is very well organized, which walks you through basic algorithms with a few more steps exploration. Team projects have heavy workload but really prepare you with actual capability in performing AI research for NLP application. This is rewarding.

Amazing lectures, amazing professor. The final project is a working end-to-end translations system which you'd be developing throughout the semester in the form of assignments. The class is heavily applications oriented. I would take any course offered by the prof.

Anoop is definitely one of the best in CS at SFU. Classes are clear, the materials on the course website clearer! The assignments are tough, but absolutely helpful. The test framework and the leaderboard helps a lot. Project is really interesting.  He cares for the subject. And his comic gestures are a cherry on the top. Do take the course.

Being a professor means teaching and evaluating students. Anoop has no idea about the 'evaluation' part. His exam consisted of 4 questions, 2 of which required learning his slides by heart and jotting down the formula. He does not test for understanding, just for parroting. The grade you get doesn't correlate with what you know. It's a disgrace.
Firstly I like his sense of humour. Four assignments are a little bit time-consuming if you are not familiar with nltk. No final exam but a final project. Btw, his TA is quite helpful and nice.
Great professor!

Explains very well, and definitely knows the material extremely well.  Be aware that assignments and exams will be very difficult and lengthy (in the case of assignments).  Start early, and do the work.
Great prof with great passion toward natural language processing.
Great instructor, but teaches difficult courses.  Updates class notes online regularly.  Not necessary to attend class, but will certainly help.  Easy to understand.
Cares about the topic. He's funny and makes the lectures interesting. Nicely laid out assignments and will give more time to class if needed. Awesome Perl Teacher.

I liked how Prof. Chang gave detailed instructions. It might seem demanding at first, but I think she's setting high and achievable goals for us so that we can complete something that we'll be proud of. Drawback: each TA seems to have different grading criteria; assignment is a little bit heavy; Prof. might want to improve explaining some concepts.
Prof. Chang should reduce the number of homeworks. She should focus more on her slides.

She is not a good instructor. She grades arbitarilly. She has plagarised the entire course. There is so much to do  that I feel really bad for the TA's. I think the grading is arbitary. 

I WOULD NOT ADVISE TAKING HER COURSE.

RETHINK PLEASE !!!
Very hard assignments.

If you are not a fan of writing research paper, do not choose this class. She is very demanding, asking for details on every single thing, code, jupyternote explaining, conference level paper. Add on tough grading, congrats, you got low points for so much work.
For final, expect 3 iterations of paper writing and a video.
DO NOT choose her class.
Very long homeworks and unrealisitc expectations. 100% would not recommend
The grading scheme is absurd. She should pay more attention to her slides.
Straight up a lot of homeworks. Classes are not useful.

Bad prof and confusing lectures. If you feel like your time is cheap, just go to this class. Otherwise, NEVER EVER take this profs class. Also, the grading scale is absurd, 98 is for A+, remember that this is a 400-level CS course! Students are also not allowed to ask for regrading for final project.

Contents were boring. Unfair marking to assignments and doesnt respond to mark appeals. Final projects marked wrong but cant do anything because she doesnt allow you to do mark appeals for the final project. TAs werent helpful, all questions were answered with: I cannot help with that.

The course material is quite dry and challenging though, Angel is really glad to explain to students. Writing assignments helped a lot to understand the concepts. Programming assignments were interesting and much to explore. No quiz or exam. But Angel has high expectation on analysis in reports and coding skills.
Dry but useful material. Programming assignments are focus on both coding and analysis. Nice prof

The overall topics are interesting and useful. Although it is a little bit difficult to understand, the conceptual homework will help you figure it out. Programmings are not that heavy loaded. A nice professor.

I was super excited to take this class! I was deeply interested in the subject matter and the Prof had amazing credentials (She had no RMP ratings then) on paper. However my experience was really bad. The class is dry, lectures don't have a coherent narrative and she does not really answer questions. Overall, probably the worst class I've taken.

She doesn't know the stuff she teaches. She spent most of the class introducing useless background information and skipped a lot of technical details. When we try to ask her questions, she can't answer most of the time. She deducts marks for reports heavily in code assn even if you get full marks for code. Written assn are also marked strictly.

The course material is incredibly hard and super confusing. I completed all of the prerequisites before enrolling in this course, but I found there is no way for me to figure out what is this course about. The professor skips a lot of introductions for some unfamiliar concepts but jumped into depth directly. Overall, terrible experience! :(
Very enthusiastic, very interested in the topic, gives very good lectures. Assignments were reasonable and well-related. Readily available for help.

Very enthusiastic and knowledgeable in the material. The assignments and project were manageable and closely related to the class material.
 
 He uses powerpoint.
What a horrible professor.  Lack of interest and pure neglect for the teaching aspect of computational linguistics.
No Comments
